chargeHist.descr: Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Richard S. Brown

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Richard S. Brown in court, in custody.  Attorney Seth Elijah Johnson in court for Richard S. Brown.  Prosecuting attorney Drew Lehman in court for the State of Wisconsin. Clerk Dana A.  Minutes: DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found.  Bound over.   Information filed; reading waived.  Not guilty plea entered. Scheduling Order given to Attorney in court.  Bond continued.
Judicial Pretrial - in court scheduled for December 7, 2022 at 10:00 am.

1:24 PM
Attorney Zachary Brost appeared for the State. Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Seth Johnson. Clerk Dana A.  Minutes: Preliminary Hearing set for 10/5/22 @830am. Bond continued as previously set. ec

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: 01:15 PM    Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in custody.  Clerk JT  Minutes: Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 22, 2022 at 01:00 pm. Attorney status. Bond continued posted w/ same conditions (see bond entry). SPD has not appointed counsel for DE.  DE waives time for the preliminary hearing. rb

02:08 - 02:10 PM   State appeared by Attorney Drew Lehman.  Defendant appeared in custody.  Clerk PU. Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 01:00 pm.  Bond continued as previously set.  SPD has not appointed counsel for DE. DE waives time for the preliminary hearing.  sg

Defendant Richard S. Brown in court, in custody.  Attorney Brendaliz Valdes appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  SPD has been unable to appoint an attorney for DE for today's hearing. Court holds colloquy with DE re: proceeding pro se or waiving time to allow SPD to appoint an attorney.  DE waives time for preliminary hearing. Court reschedules preliminary hearing to an attorney status hearing.  Bond continued.  Status conference scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM.
  *Not to Possess or Consume Alcohol.  *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.  *No Weapons especially firearms.   No contact including the residence, electronic or 3rd party with: Sara S - or any of her children, MTB, KSD Dep C. K. except in professional capacity

02:25 PM   Assistant District Attorney Daniel Bernard Deida appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Francesco Balistrieri.   Clerk JT  Minutes:  Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 10 days;  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 28, 2022 at 09:00 am.. $25000   Cash Bond Set w/conditions (see bond entry). rb
